body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**: Bug report
/kind bug

**What happened**: Trying to implement stage 1 cloud provider controller manager for GCE (or azure etc) and run the e2e tests we see a lot of errors trying to load the relevant plugin. For this we have the cloud provider on kube controller manager set to external. There are two plugin managers, one of which has the relevant plugins but the other does not. So we are loading the plugin, however when we go through the hampered plugin manager we get an error loading the plugin.

**What you expected to happen**: Until we properly separate the cloud provider plugins from kube-controller-manager the plugin should be found.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: Get state 1 working for one of the affected cloud providers. 

**Anything else we need to know?**: I believe we do want to remove the cloud plugins from kube-controller-manager, however the current attempt is not complete and I think hampering us from doing it the way we want to.

**Environment**: GCE
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.9
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: GCE
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Storage.
labels.name: sig/storage

title: Failure to load some of the volume plugins when cloud set to external.
